description: Grace period in minutes before overtime starts counting. Example: If set to 30, overtime will only count after working 8 hours + 30 minutes.
label: Overtime Allowance (Minutes)
name: Shift Type-overtime_allowance_minutes
Shift Type-overtime_calculation_info
options:
How Overtime is Calculated:
  • Standard Work Hours: 8 hours
  • Overtime Threshold: 8 hours + Allowance Minutes
  • Overtime Hours = (Total Worked - 8 hours - Allowance Minutes)
  • Only positive values count as overtime

Example: If allowance is 30 minutes:
• Employee works 9 hours → OT = 9 - 8 - 0.5 = 0.5 hours
• Employee works 8.5 hours → OT = 8.5 - 8 - 0.5 = 0 hours (within allowance)

name: Shift Type-overtime_reset_info
options:
Time Reset on Rejection:
When overtime is rejected, checkout time is reset to:
Check-in Time + 8 hours + Allowance Minutes + 3-4 seconds

The 3-4 second variance ensures each reset is unique for audit purposes.

description: Auto-calculated: Base / Standard Hours per Month
label: Hourly Rate
name: Salary Structure Assignment-hourly_rate

description: 3-4 seconds variance for non-eligible employee reset
label: Overtime Variance Seconds (Non-Eligible)
name: HR Settings-overtime_variance_seconds
